intro: Rhagodia obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed rhagodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features compound leaves with a broad, ovate shape and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. Rhagodia obovata is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the biodiversity of native Australian flora.
